caption: Fantastic museum to explore the history of Paris, and it's free. Beautiful exhibits from medieval times to the Revolution. You might find a queue, but it moves quickly, and the museum isn't too crowded. Perfect for history lovers, I highly recommend

It's a pretty big museum and the good thing is it's FREE to visit. The collection displayed is also very prominent and unique. But the museum map is a bit confusing. And also try not to miss the garden access where you can sit and relax while having a coffee. The good thing about this museum is that it's part of the Paris Museums and the permanent exhibition is completely free in this museum so you should visit here if you have enough time and want to amaze yourself. You can also witness a lot of art and history about Paris and see how medusa was influencing people in the olden times. I definitely recommend going to this museum.

Very interesting free museum! Had the opportunity to tour with my university and the guide was very informative. I was using a mobility device at the time for a broken ankle and there was ample accessibility accommodations, including a separate entrance and multiple elevators to access each floor. Artwork reveals Paris‚Äô rich history. Paintings and other artifacts of the first hot air balloon on display. Features a wonderful look into Benjamin Franklin‚Äôs diplomacy and residence in France. Other objects of note include the first punctuation marker, many building models, and tributes to Paris‚Äô architecture and history with the Olympic Games.

10/17/2024  What a great museum and with free entry to the permanent exhibit, it's an amazing deal. It was a really large exhibit too. From the history of Paris and France to a collection of signs and building decor, there were tons of interesting things to see.

Free entry hidden gem of Paris. You can find out here the history of the city, from Roman to nowadays. It‚Äôs an interactive museum great for children and adults also. There is a collection of paintings and lots of of works of art. History of Paris is often history of France, so here you can both enjoy.

Amazing, stunning, impressive, breathtaking and much more! Really: take the time to visit this free entry museum, pretty big and on 4 floors (easy access for any limited movement person). At the end, stop by the local cafe (pricy but worth for the beauty of this place) and relax while enjoying the surroundings.

Fantastic and Free! Especially enjoyed the medieval & ancient history and the revolution exhibits. Honestly worth it even just for the salvaged signage in the first few rooms. A great place to get a thorough history of the city.

Came at 4pm on a Friday - no wait and wasn't crowded at all. Considering that it's free, it's hard to complain about anything. It's a very large museum (about 3-4 floors) with a large collection of pieces (art, history) as well. Small lockers are also available at the entrance for about 3‚Ç¨.  Personally, I wasn't a big fan of the displays so I wouldn't recommend prioritizing a visit here, but if you have some downtime, and looking for something free to do, this can be a decent option.

Free Museum that shows the history of Paris.  I just walked in on a Saturday because booking ahead online I could not find the free option.  There was no wait.  I only had about 45 minutes to spend and I felt like I saw a lot but I could have spent more time reading and understating more.  It did include ancient remains that have been dug up over the years while renovating the city.  Also it showed old coinage that way used throughout history.

A museum which is worth going; it‚Äôs free and so much to offer! Easily spend 1-2hrs here. Got to know more about the history of Paris‚Ä¶  There‚Äôs chairs n benches for a short rest Toilets are big and clean too :)

When you are travelling on a budget, it pays to research cheap or free places to visit. Paris has numerous museums and attractions that fit that category and Carnavalet Museum, with its free entry is one of them.

The first museum we visited in Paris. Entry is free, and there aren‚Äôt as many people compared to other museums. However, there‚Äôs plenty to see, and the museum is not small, so make sure to set aside a couple of hours to immerse yourself in history.

You need at least an hour, more of you read lots of the descriptions. The place is a bit of a maze, but lots of interesting historic French content. Free entry to the permanent collection and lots of other sights nearby, so worth a stop. Also, they don't use rope barriers, just a small, raised but of wood on the floor which triggers an alarm if you step over it (tried and tested ü§£).

My favorite section by far is in the basement; on the prehistory through medieval era of Paris. The artifacts are well displayed and so close. This is a very big museum and by the end I was a little faded. My third time in Paris and first time at this museum. I will be back.

Interesting to look through Paris‚Äô history and the museum is free so you can‚Äôt beat that deal. They also have free lockers to stow away your things while you walk around the museum. And the garden is beautiful and serene.
A large collection focused on the everyday life and style of Parisians throughout the centuries. You will need more than an hour just to walk this beautiful building. It can get very crowded.
It was huge.. really huge!! Its actually a museum of history of Paris. I was awestruck. But please visit all the rooms. People get confused inside.
Absolutely wonderful ü•∞ A must see in Paris. A free museum, with a lot to learn about the city of Paris, French culture and French history in general üôè Not to be missed üòâ

You can‚Äôt miss this museum! And I‚Äôm still in awe that it was free to admire the vast collection. I loved the extensive tactile and braille exhibits. And the app with the audio recordings was easy to use.  There was a bit of a line getting into the building because of the metal detector. And another wait for a free locker to become available (you are not allowed to walk around with a backpack). It was absolutely worth the wait! I need to go back!

We did not have time to appreciate all that this museum had to offer, but the fact that entry is free, it‚Äôs a beautiful, well maintained exhibition of historic Paris and the garden courtyards are stunning, make it well worth a look.

Excellent Museum, if you want to visit Paris, this museum should on your list. Museum Carnavalet is one the best museum. You can see the history of Paris since the Prehistoric period until the 21st Century.  The permanent exhibition is free to enter, you don't have to make reservation. The details of artifact dan the information is good. You will spend one day to visit every room and enjoy different kind of artifact and information about the development of Paris.  Don't forget to buy souvenirs in the shop when you finish museum tour. My recommendation you buy coin commorative from the museum.  You will not regret to visit this museum. Finger cross!

Possibly the best museum in Paris. While it is focused on the history of the city, there is so much to browse through you might end up spending the day there. With a free permanent collection and staggering number of pieces spanning prehistoric times to current day there is a lot to see and learn about.

some parts are organized like the paris salon which i loved. there are also some art nouveau works including one room which is entirely decked out in art nouveau style. great past time (especially because its free!)

A good collection of items across generations of Paris, considering how much damage the city has had over the centuries. The layout is supposed to be a one way in and through thing but it was actually quite confusing. There were others around me that also didn‚Äôt know where to go or how to get somewhere specific. Also, I know museum food prices aren‚Äôt competitive in most cases, but paying 6‚Ç¨ for a coke is a joke. There was also a weird point where they talked about the city prior to the name and then just declared ‚Äúand then it was renamed Paris‚Äù but no why, how, what it means, nothing  Recommended if you‚Äôre interested in learning about the history of Paris.
Lovely free museum on history of Paris. Lots of artifacts and large collection of really cool old shop signs!

Such a beautiful museum in paris to visit for free. Be aware they don't accept luggage in. You can take your backpack but not luggage with wheels. There are lockers inside to leave your stuff. Also free of charge.i am super in love with this place and had so much fun exploring. I think you need to time 2 to 3 hours max for it. But absolutely a must when in paris if all other main museums are already booked. I liked the paintings, the street signs, the interior designs of old hotels, the old stuff there. Recommended.
Nice Paris' museum that's less crowded with tourists and free. I recommend taking about 3 - 4 hours, max. 5, to walk through it.

Awesome French history museum. Throughout this museum you will experience all the moments in French history through signs, portraits, paintings, furniture, daily objects and so much more. The corridors are also beautifully designed. I spent several hours there and enjoyed it very much. The permanent exhibition which is 3 levels choke full of history is free of charge. You can donate and for special exhibitions there are tickets sold. Definitely a must see for anyone interested in history.

I couldn‚Äôt believe how good this free museum was. The first floor has old store front signs from around Paris. The second floor exhibits the palace rooms and furniture, very authentic. The top floor is dedicated to the history of French revolution, and it has some impressive art pieces. Highly recommended, I spent around 2,3 hours here.
This is a must see gem about the history of Paris beautifully presented with the most charming garden cafe ever. Free entry
Very well maintained and it's free to visit no tickets and great art collection

It's great bc it's free.  I'm no big fan of museums.  Been to too many and think what they mostly show is anachronistic in the age of modern media.  That said, there are some interesting exhibits worth checking out if you have a lot of time but there are other museums you should see first like Louvre and Invalides etc. One huge plus is there bathrooms are great if you're picky and in the area. No lines and quick turnaround make for a solid alternative.
Beautiful museum and it's FREE in Paris.  Not overcrowded so you can relax and take your time to watch painting.
Super museum to learn about long history of Paris, from prehistoric and ancient to the modern daysüëå ‚Ä¶

This museum in Paris follows the history of the city of Paris. Very interesting displays from early Roman times up to the present. It is located in the Marais district. And the best part is that it is free. üòä
Super interesting on the prehistory of Paris, well laid out, not cramped, cute gift store

This is a fantastic museum, and it‚Äôs free. The museum traces the history of Paris from prehistoric times. The collections are arranged well. The buildings themselves are very interesting. Well worth visiting.

the museum showcases a good amount of artifact and i recommend staying for 2 hours. can be quite crowded with the tourists but a gem in the area. the sign exhibition on the ground floor was the most impactful on me.
